Given that for work-life balance model the posterior distribution of
pandemic term crosses the zero value, it would be useful to know how
strong is the evidence in the favor of hypothesis that pandemic term is
lower than zero. For that purpose we can extract posterior samples and
use them for calculation of the proportion of values that are
larger/smaller than zero. The resulting proportions show that the vast
majority (around 92%) of posterior distribution lies below zero.


Show code

# extracting posterior samples
samples <- brms::posterior_samples(modelWorkLifeBalance, seed = 12345)

# probability of b_pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak coefficient being lower than 0
sum(samples$b_pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak < 0) / nrow(samples)


[1] 0.920875

Show code

# probability of b_pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak coefficient being higher than 0
sum(samples$b_pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak > 0) / nrow(samples)


[1] 0.079125


Another option would be to compute Bayes factor that
expresses degree to which available data favors our hypothesis in
comparison with the null model corresponding to normal prior
distribution with the parameters normal(0,50). We can see
that Bayes factor (Evid.Ratio in the table below) has value
of 11.6 which indicates strong evidence in favor of our hypothesis, in
terms of Harold
Jeffreys‚Äô scale for interpretation of Bayes factors. Specifically it
means that under the fitted model for work-life balance the hypothesis
about pandemic term being lower than zero is 11.6 times more probable
than under the null model. In other words, the data should shift our
believe pretty strongly in direction of acceptance of the existence of
pandemic‚Äôs positive effect on people‚Äôs search interest in work-life
balance.


Show code

# computing Bayes factor for hypothesis that pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak term in the modelWorkLifeBalance is smaller than zero  
brms::hypothesis(
  modelWorkLifeBalance,
  "pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak < 0",
  seed = 12345
  )


Hypothesis Tests for class b:
                Hypothesis Estimate Est.Error CI.Lower CI.Upper
1 (pandemicBeforeth... < 0   -14.01      9.97   -30.28     2.57
  Evid.Ratio Post.Prob Star
1      11.64      0.92     
---
'CI': 90%-CI for one-sided and 95%-CI for two-sided hypotheses.
'*': For one-sided hypotheses, the posterior probability exceeds 95%;
for two-sided hypotheses, the value tested against lies outside the 95%-CI.
Posterior probabilities of point hypotheses assume equal prior probabilities.



Show code

# plotting prior and posterior distribution for pandemic term in the modelWorkLifeBalance is smaller than zero   
plot(
  brms::hypothesis(
    modelWorkLifeBalance,
    "pandemicBeforethepandemicoutbreak < 0"
  )
)




Graph 6: Visualization of prior and posterior distribution of
pandemic term in the modelWorkLifeBalance.

Besides the major hypothesis we may be also interested in‚Ä¶
overall trend across the last ten years,
trend after the outbreak of pandemic, and also
seasonality of people‚Äôs search interest over the months within
individual years.
For that purpose we might use, besides the summary statistics and
graphs with posterior distributions depicted above, plots showing
conditional effect of each of the predictors. From the plots in Graph 7
it is thus clear that in case of work-life balance searches, the overall
trend across the last ten years is decreasing, after the outbreak of
pandemic the trend is rather stagnating, and within individual years the
search interest follows work & holiday seasonality (lower search
interest during the holiday parts of the year - June, July, August and
December - and higher during the rest of the year). In case of
well-being searches, the seasonality part is similar, but the trends
differ - both of them are increasing (see Graph 8).


Show code

# plotting conditional effect of each predictor from modelWorkLifeBalance 
figListWorkLifeBalance <- plot(brms::conditional_effects(modelWorkLifeBalance), ask = FALSE)





Show code

# uploading library for arranging multiple ggplots
library(ggpubr)

# putting all graphs with conditional effect together  
ggpubr::ggarrange(
  plotlist = figListWorkLifeBalance, 
  nrow = 4
  ) %>%
  ggpubr::annotate_figure(
    top = text_grob("Conditional effect of predictors from modelWorkLifeBalance")
)




Graph 7: Visualization of conditional effect of predictors from
modelWorkLifeBalance. The predictors are conditioned on the mean in the
case of continuous variables and reference category in the case of
factors.



Show code

# plotting conditional effect of each predictor from modelWellBeing  
figListWellBeing <- plot(brms::conditional_effects(modelWellBeing), ask = FALSE)





Show code

# putting all graphs with conditional effect together  
ggpubr::ggarrange(
  plotlist = figListWellBeing, 
  nrow = 4
  ) %>% 
  ggpubr::annotate_figure(
    top = text_grob("Conditional effect of predictors from modelWellBeing")
)




Graph 8: Visualization of conditional effect of predictors from
modelWellBeing. The predictors are conditioned on the mean in the case
of continuous variables and reference category in the case of
factors.

In conclusion, we can say that there is some evidence that the
COVID-19 pandemic has prompted people to be more interested in topics
related to work-life balance and well-being. I wish us all to be able to
transform our increased interest in these topics into truly increased
quality of our personal and professional lives. It would be a shame not
to use that extra incentive many of us have now for making significant
change in our lives.

Co je to HR analytika?

& Richardson, 1997).

anga≈æovanosti?
Kde se v organizaci nach√°z√≠ izolovan√° sila a √∫zk√° hrdla znemo≈æ≈àuj√≠c√≠
efektivn√≠ komunikaci a spolupr√°ci mezi jednotliv√Ωmi zamƒõstnanci, t√Ωmy
nebo i cel√Ωmi oddƒõlen√≠mi?

rozv√≠jet?

a kdo naopak m≈Ø≈æe b√Ωt jejich ambasadorem a katalyz√°torem?
Kter√© faktory p≈ôisp√≠vaj√≠ k odchodovosti zamƒõstnanc≈Ø a u kter√Ωch
konkr√©tn√≠ch zamƒõstnanc≈Ø je zv√Ω≈°en√© riziko, ≈æe firmu bƒõhem nƒõkolika
p≈ô√≠≈°t√≠ch mƒõs√≠c≈Ø opust√≠?
Odchodovost
zamƒõstnanc≈Ø a jej√≠ prediktory
Pr√°vƒõ poslednƒõ jmenovan√Ω zp≈Øsob vyu≈æit√≠ HR analytiky ƒçasto
p≈ôedstavuje jeden z prvn√≠ch druh≈Ø HR analytick√Ωch projekt≈Ø, kter√Ωmi se
ve firm√°ch s HR analytikou zaƒç√≠n√°, a to z dob≈ôe pochopiteln√©ho d≈Øvodu. S
ne≈æ√°douc√≠mi odchody zamƒõstnanc≈Ø jsou toti≈æ spojen√© vysok√©
p≈ô√≠m√© i nep≈ô√≠m√© n√°klady, tak≈æe i pomƒõrnƒõ m√≠rn√© sn√≠≈æen√≠ odchodovosti
zamƒõstnanc≈Ø m≈Ø≈æe p≈ôedstavovat znaƒçnou √∫sporu, kterou ocen√≠ management
ka≈æd√© firmy. Nal√©havost tohoto probl√©mu nav√≠c je≈°tƒõ zvy≈°uje souƒçasn√°
f√°ze ekonomick√©ho cyklu s rekordnƒõ n√≠zkou m√≠rou nezamƒõstnanosti, kter√° v
kombinaci s r≈Øzn√Ωmi on-line platformami na zprost≈ôedkov√°n√≠ pr√°ce
motivuje mnoho lid√≠ k hled√°n√≠ nov√©ho m√≠sta, kde, jak doufaj√≠, bude pr√°ce
zaj√≠mavƒõj≈°√≠, smysluplnƒõj≈°√≠ a l√©pe placen√° a kde kolegov√© budou
sympatiƒçtƒõj≈°√≠ a ≈°√©fov√© inspirativnƒõj≈°√≠. Viz tak√© graf n√≠≈æe, kter√Ω na
datech z USA n√°zornƒõ dokl√°d√° tƒõsnost vztahu mezi m√≠rou nezamƒõstnanosti a
m√≠rou dobrovoln√© odchodovosti zamƒõstnanc≈Ø (r = -0,95,
p < 0,001 ).



Vzhledem k palƒçivosti tohoto probl√©mu, kter√Ω tr√°p√≠ nejednu firmu,
nen√≠ ≈æ√°dn√Ωm velk√Ωm p≈ôekvapen√≠m, ≈æe se t√©matu odchodovosti zamƒõstnanc≈Ø
vƒõnovalo a st√°le vƒõnuje velk√© mno≈æstv√≠ r≈Øzn√Ωch studi√≠. Takto nap≈ô. na
konci roku 2017 vy≈°la rozs√°hl√° meta-anal√Ωza od autor≈Ø Rubensteina,
Eberlyov√© a Leeho, kte≈ô√≠ syntetizovali v√Ωsledky v√≠ce ne≈æ 300 d√≠lƒç√≠ch
v√Ωzkum≈Ø t√Ωkaj√≠c√≠ch se prediktor≈Ø odchodovosti. M≈Ø≈æeme se tak opr√°vnƒõnƒõ
pt√°t, co nov√©ho n√°m m≈Ø≈æe p≈ôin√©st HR analytika zamƒõ≈ôen√° na odchodovost
zamƒõstnanc≈Ø realizovan√° pouze v jedin√© organizaci. Nebylo v≈°e podstatn√©
k tomuto t√©matu ji≈æ objeveno? (K t√©to ot√°zce viz nap≈ô. tento
inspirativn√≠ a trochu provokativn√≠ ƒçl√°nek od Thomase
Rasmussena.) Je pravda, ≈æe nen√≠ p≈ô√≠li≈° pravdƒõpodobn√©, ≈æe p≈ôi anal√Ωze
va≈°ich vlastn√≠ch dat naraz√≠te na nƒõjak√Ω naprosto nov√Ω faktor souvisej√≠c√≠

# Vyfiltrujme si opƒõt data mezi lety 1996-2001. 
moneyball2 <- moneyball %>%
  filter(Year < 2002 & Year > 1995)

# Vytvo≈ôme si seznam nƒõkolika r≈Øzn√Ωch hodnot poƒçtu v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe.
pocet_vitezstvi <- seq(60,115,5)
ucast_v_playoff <- vector(mode="numeric", length=length(pocet_vitezstvi))
playoff_data <- data.frame(pocet_vitezstvi = pocet_vitezstvi, ucast_v_playoff = ucast_v_playoff)

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si, jak√° je pravdƒõpodobnost postupu do play-off p≈ôi r≈Øzn√©m poƒçtu v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe.
for(i in 1:nrow(playoff_data)){
 playoff_data$ucast_v_playoff[i] <- length(moneyball2$W[moneyball2$W >= playoff_data$pocet_vitezstvi[i] & moneyball2$Playoffs == 1])/length(moneyball2$W[moneyball2$W >= playoff_data$pocet_vitezstvi[i]]) 
}

ggplot(playoff_data, aes(x = pocet_vitezstvi, y = ucast_v_playoff))+

  ggtitle("Souvislost mezi poƒçtem v√Ωher v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe a\npravdƒõpodobnost√≠ postupu t√Ωmu do play-off (1996-2001)")+
  ylab("Pravdƒõpodobnost postupu t√Ωmu do play-off")+

  scale_x_continuous(limits=c(60,115), breaks = seq(60,115,5))+

        axis.title = element_text(size=11))




3. krok: Kladen√≠ ot√°zek a
mƒõ≈ôen√≠
S takto definovan√Ωm a kvantifikovan√Ωm c√≠lem si potom m≈Ø≈æeme kl√°st
dal≈°√≠ch ot√°zky, na kter√© kdy≈æ si dok√°≈æeme odpovƒõdƒõt, zv√Ω≈°√≠me t√≠m na≈°e
≈°ance na to, ≈æe tohoto c√≠le dos√°hneme. V p≈ô√≠padƒõ oaklandsk√Ωch ‚Äû√Åƒçek‚Äú se
m≈Ø≈æeme pt√°t, d√≠ky ƒçemu t√Ωm dosahuje v z√°pasech v√≠tƒõzstv√≠? Celkem zjevn√°
odpovƒõƒè zn√≠, ≈æe d√≠ky tomu, ≈æe dok√°≈æe z√≠skat v√≠ce bod≈Ø ne≈æ jeho soupe≈ôi.
Ot√°zkou ale je, p≈ôesnƒõ o kolik bod≈Ø nav√≠c mus√≠ t√Ωm z√≠skat, aby v
z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe dos√°hl na minim√°lnƒõ 95 v√≠tƒõzstv√≠. K zodpovƒõzen√≠
t√©to ot√°zky opƒõt pot≈ôebujeme historick√° data (√∫daje o vyhran√Ωch a
prohran√Ωch bodech) a relativnƒõ jednoduch√Ω statistick√Ω model zvan√Ω line√°rn√≠
regrese, pomoc√≠ kter√©ho m≈Ø≈æeme popsat vztah mezi poƒçtem vyhran√Ωch
z√°pas≈Ø v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe a rozd√≠lem mezi vyhran√Ωmi a prohran√Ωmi
body. Z n√≠≈æe uveden√©ho grafu je z≈ôejm√©, ≈æe mezi tƒõmito dvƒõma promƒõnn√Ωmi
je velice tƒõsn√Ω vztah a ≈æe spolu velice silnƒõ koreluj√≠.

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si rozd√≠l mezi vyhran√Ωmi a prohran√Ωmi body
moneyball <- moneyball %>%
  mutate(RD = RS - RA)

# Graficky si zn√°zornƒõme vztah mezi poƒçtem vyhran√Ωch z√°pas≈Ø v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe a rozd√≠lem mezi vyhran√Ωmi a prohran√Ωmi body
library(ggpubr)

  ggtitle("Vztah mezi poƒçtem v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe a\nrozd√≠lem mezi vyhran√Ωmi a prohran√Ωmi body")+
  xlab("Rozd√≠l mezi poƒçtem vyhran√Ωch a prohran√Ωch bod≈Ø")+
  ylab("Poƒçet v√≠tƒõzstv√≠")+
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 11),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 11))+
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-350,350), breaks = seq(-350,350,50))+
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(40, 120), breaks = seq(40,120,10))+

P≈ôi pou≈æit√≠ modelu line√°rn√≠ regrese m≈Ø≈æeme vztah mezi tƒõmito dvƒõma

4. krok: Kladen√≠
dal≈°√≠ch ot√°zek a dal≈°√≠ mƒõ≈ôen√≠
T√≠mto zji≈°tƒõn√≠m se n√°≈° c√≠l opƒõt trochu v√≠ce specifikuje a vyvol√°v√°
dal≈°√≠ ot√°zky. Ot√°zka, kter√° se t√©mƒõ≈ô sama nab√≠z√≠, se t√Ωk√° charakteristik
hr√°ƒç≈Ø, kter√© nejl√©pe p≈ôedpov√≠daj√≠ poƒçet vyhran√Ωch a prohran√Ωch bod≈Ø, a
t√≠m tedy tak√© pravdƒõpodobnost postupu t√Ωmu do play-off. DePodesta na
z√°kladƒõ sv√Ωch anal√Ωz zjistil, ≈æe poƒçet vyhran√Ωch bod≈Ø nejtƒõsnƒõji souvis√≠
s procentem p≈ô√≠pad≈Ø, kdy se hr√°ƒç dostane na metu (tzv. On-Base
Percentage - OBP), a to, jak daleko se hr√°ƒç dostane p≈ôi sv√©m odpalu
(tzv. Slugging Percentage - SLG). Analogick√© statistiky pro
t√Ωmy soupe≈ô≈Ø (OOBP a OSLG) potom stejnƒõ dob≈ôe p≈ôedpov√≠daj√≠ poƒçet
prohran√Ωch bod≈Ø. Kdy≈æ vztah mezi tƒõmito promƒõnn√Ωmi pop√≠≈°eme opƒõt pomoc√≠
modelu line√°rn√≠ regrese, m≈Ø≈æeme se s jeho pomoc√≠ pokusit p≈ôedpovƒõdƒõt,
jak si t√Ωm povede p≈ô√≠≈°t√≠ sez√≥nu. Takov√° p≈ôedpovƒõƒè by p≈ôitom mohla b√Ωt
potenci√°lnƒõ velice u≈æiteƒçn√°, proto≈æe na jej√≠m z√°kladƒõ bychom p≈ô√≠padnƒõ
mohli upravit nƒõkter√° sv√° rozhodnut√≠ o koupi nebo prodeji vybran√Ωch
hr√°ƒç≈Ø. Pojƒème tuto p≈ôedpovƒõƒè vytvo≈ôit pro t√Ωm oaklandsk√Ωch ‚Äû√Åƒçek‚Äú pro
sez√≥nu 2002 na z√°kladƒõ dat z let 1962-2001. Z p≈ôedchoz√≠ anal√Ωzy ji≈æ
v√≠me, ≈æe‚Ä¶

# Hr√°ƒçsk√©/t√Ωmov√© statistiky oaklandsk√Ωch ‚Äû√Åƒçek‚Äú za rok 2001
OBP_OAK <- moneyball$OBP[which(moneyball$Team=="OAK" & moneyball$Year == 2001)]
SLG_OAK <- moneyball$SLG[which(moneyball$Team=="OAK" & moneyball$Year == 2001)]
OOBP_OAK <- moneyball$OOBP[which(moneyball$Team=="OAK" & moneyball$Year == 2001)]
OSLG_OAK <- moneyball$OSLG[which(moneyball$Team=="OAK" & moneyball$Year == 2001)]

# Pravdƒõpodobn√© hodnoty vybran√Ωch statistik oaklandsk√Ωch "√Åƒçek" pro rok 2002 vypoƒç√≠tan√© s pomoc√≠ odhadnut√Ωch regresn√≠ch model≈Ø
pocet_vyhranych_bodu_pred <- round(-804.63 + 2737.77*OBP_OAK + 1584.91*SLG_OAK)
pocet_prohranych_bodu_pred <- round(-837.38 + 2913.60*OOBP_OAK + 1514.29*OSLG_OAK)
pocet_vitezstvi_pred <- round(80.88 + 0.106 * (pocet_vyhranych_bodu_pred - pocet_prohranych_bodu_pred), 0)

# Skuteƒçn√© hodnoty vybran√Ωch statistik oaklandsk√Ωch "√Åƒçek" pro rok 2002
pocet_vyhranych_bodu_real <- baseball$RS[which(baseball$Team=="OAK" & baseball$Year == 2002)] 
pocet_prohranych_bodu_real <- baseball$RA[which(baseball$Team=="OAK" & baseball$Year == 2002)] 
pocet_vitezstvi_real <- baseball$W[which(baseball$Team=="OAK" & baseball$Year == 2002)]

# Tabulka porovn√°vaj√≠c√≠ statistick√© p≈ôedpovƒõdi se skuteƒçnost√≠ 
pred <- c(pocet_vyhranych_bodu_pred, pocet_prohranych_bodu_pred, pocet_vitezstvi_pred)
real <- c(pocet_vyhranych_bodu_real, pocet_prohranych_bodu_real, pocet_vitezstvi_real)

krok: Propojen√≠ d√≠lƒç√≠ch vhled≈Ø aneb organizace jako stroj
Matt Dancho ve
sv√© metodice k datovƒõ-analytick√Ωm projekt≈Øm doporuƒçuje, abychom se p≈ôi
snaze o pochopen√≠ obchodn√≠ho probl√©mu organizace na danou organizaci
d√≠vali jako na druh stroje, kter√Ω m√° urƒçit√© vstupy, procesy a v√Ωstupy.
Tuto metaforu stroje m≈Ø≈æeme nyn√≠ vyu≈æ√≠t k tomu, abychom v≈°echny v√Ω≈°e
uveden√© d√≠lƒç√≠ vhledy spojili do jednotn√©ho r√°mce. V nƒõm budou m√≠t
oaklandsk√° ‚Äú√Åƒçka‚Äù podobu jednoduch√©ho stroje na v√Ωrobu postup≈Ø do
play-off - viz obr√°zek n√≠≈æe.

Ze sch√©matu je dob≈ôe patrn√©, jak tento stroj funguje: Jeho v√Ωstupy
jsou postupy do play-off, kter√Ωch dosahuje tak, ≈æe se sna≈æ√≠ vyhr√°t v√≠ce
z√°pas≈Ø, resp. z√≠skat v√≠ce bod≈Ø ne≈æ soupe≈ô√≠c√≠ t√Ωmy; k tomu vyu≈æ√≠v√° vstupy

ovliv≈àuj√≠c√≠m chod stroje jsou rovnƒõ≈æ obdobn√© schopnosti hr√°ƒç≈Ø
soupe≈ô√≠c√≠ch t√Ωm≈Ø. Jedn√° se samoz≈ôejmƒõ o velmi zjednodu≈°en√Ω kauz√°ln√≠
model fungov√°n√≠ t√Ωmu oakladnsk√Ωch ‚Äú√Åƒçek‚Äù, ale jak konstatuje slavn√Ω
statistick√Ω aforismus, modely jsou
v≈ædy nep≈ôesn√©, ale nƒõkter√© z nich jsou u≈æiteƒçn√©.
Jakkoli na≈°e modely fungov√°n√≠ organizace budou v≈ædy ne√∫pln√©, je

odr√°≈æej√≠ realitu tak, jak n√°m ji zprost≈ôedkov√°vaj√≠ dostupn√° data. Za
t√≠mto √∫ƒçelem m≈Ø≈æeme pou≈æ√≠t statistickou metodu struktur√°ln√≠ho

vztaz√≠ch mezi nƒõkolika r≈Øzn√Ωmi promƒõnn√Ωmi a zhodnotit m√≠ru souladu

vƒõrohodnosti modelu je rozumn√© na nƒõm zakl√°dat sv√° dal≈°√≠ rozhodnut√≠.
Pojƒème tedy tuto metodu pou≈æ√≠t rovnƒõ≈æ na n√°≈° novƒõ vytvo≈ôen√Ω model
fungov√°n√≠ t√Ωmu oaklandsk√Ωch ‚Äú√Åƒçek‚Äù a ovƒõ≈ôit m√≠ru jeho vƒõrohodnosti.

# Data, kter√° budeme pot≈ôebovat pro ovƒõ≈ôen√≠ vƒõrohodnosti na≈°eho modelu fungov√°n√≠ oaklandsk√Ωch "√Åƒçek" 
sem_data <- moneyball %>%
  filter(Year < 2002 & Year > 1995) %>%
  select(RS, RA, RD, W, Playoffs, OBP, SLG, OOBP, OSLG)

# Definice modelu, kter√° je v souladu s v√Ω≈°e uveden√Ωm sch√©matem
library(lavaan)
oak_model <- '
     Playoffs ~ W
     W ~ RS + RA
     RA ~ OOBP + OSLG
     RS ~ OBP + SLG 
'
# Odhad parametr≈Ø modelu
fit_oak_model <- sem(oak_model, data = sem_data, missing = "pairwise", estimator = "WLSMV", ordered = "Playoffs")
summary(fit_oak_model, standardized = T, fit.measures = T, rsq = T)

# Naƒçtƒõme si pot≈ôebn√° data Lahmanovy baseballov√© datab√°ze, kter√° je ve≈ôejnƒõ p≈ô√≠stupn√° na adrese http://seanlahman.com/baseball-archive/statistics/
mzdyHracu <- read_csv("salaries.csv")
vyhryTymu <- read_csv("teams.csv")

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si pr≈Ømƒõrnou sumu mezd vypl√°cen√Ωch jednotliv√Ωmi t√Ωmy sv√Ωm hr√°ƒç≈Øm v letech 1998-2001 
prumerna_suma_MezdHracu <- mzdyHracu %>%
  filter(yearID > 1997 & yearID < 2002) %>%

  summarise(prumerna_suma_MezdHracu = sum(salary)/length(unique(yearID)))

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si pro jednotliv√© t√Ωmy pr≈Ømƒõrn√Ω poƒçet v√Ωher za sez√≥nu v letech 1998-2001
prumerny_pocet_vyher <- vyhryTymu %>%
  filter(yearID > 1997 & yearID < 2002) %>%

# Vyj√°d≈ôeme si graficky vztah mezi poƒçtem v√Ωher a mno≈æstv√≠m penƒõz, kter√© t√Ωmy vynakl√°daj√≠ na mzdy sv√Ωch hr√°ƒç≈Ø 
library(ggrepel)
prumerna_suma_MezdHracu %>%
  left_join(prumerny_pocet_vyher, "teamID") %>%
  mutate(OAK = ifelse(teamID == "OAK", "ano", "ne")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x= prumerna_suma_MezdHracu, y = prumerny_pocet_vyher, fill = OAK)) +
  geom_point()+
  ggtitle("Mzdy hr√°ƒç≈Ø a poƒçet v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v letech 1998-2001")+
  xlab("Pr≈Ømƒõrn√° suma mezd hr√°ƒç≈Ø (USD)")+
  ylab("Pr≈Ømƒõrn√Ω poƒçet v√Ωher za sez√≥nu")+
  geom_label_repel(
    aes(label = teamID),
    box.padding = 0.25, point.padding = 0.25,
    segment.color = 'grey50')+
  theme(legend.position="none")+
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#ffd400", "#ffffff"), 
                        labels = c("ano","ne"))+
  scale_y_continuous(limits=c(65,100), breaks = seq(65,100,5)) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits=c(2e+07,9e+07), breaks = seq(2e+07,9e+07,1e+07))




Omezen√≠ HR analytiky
P≈ôes ve≈°kerou p≈ôidanou hodnotu, kterou HR analytika pro organizaci
m≈Ø≈æe m√≠t, je vhodn√© si v≈Øƒçi n√≠ zachovat zdravou m√≠ru skepse a b√Ωt si
vƒõdom jej√≠ch omezen√≠. N√≠≈æe uv√°d√≠m p≈ôehled nƒõkolika z nich.
Kvalita a u≈æiteƒçnost v√Ωstup≈Ø HR analytiky je z√°visl√° na kvalitƒõ
dat, kter√° do n√≠ vstupuj√≠. Jako kdekoli jinde i zde plat√≠ ok≈ô√≠dlen√©
rƒçen√≠ ‚Äûrubbish in, rubbish out‚Äú. Schopnost z√≠skat pot≈ôebn√° data
vƒças, v dostateƒçn√© kvalitƒõ a v dostateƒçn√©m mno≈æstv√≠ p≈ôitom p≈ôedstavuje
jedno z neju≈æ≈°√≠ch hrdel cel√©ho procesu zav√°dƒõn√≠ HR analytiky v
organizac√≠ch.
HR analytika pracuje s historick√Ωmi daty a vych√°z√≠ z p≈ôedpokladu,
≈æe minulost je dobr√Ωm prediktorem budoucnosti. Ale jak n√°s na to
opakovanƒõ upozor≈àuj√≠ odborn√≠ci jako Nassim
Taleb nebo Philip
Tetlock, tento vztah mezi minulost√≠ a budoucnost√≠ plat√≠ pouze do
urƒçit√© m√≠ry a pouze v relativnƒõ kr√°tk√©m ƒçasov√©m horizontu. Na ka≈æd√©m
rohu na n√°s ƒç√≠h√° nƒõjak√° potenci√°ln√≠ ƒçern√°
labu≈•, kter√° m≈Ø≈æe postavit na hlavu v≈°echno, co jsme se na z√°kladƒõ
na≈°ich minul√Ωch zku≈°enost√≠ nauƒçili br√°t jako samoz≈ôejmou
jistotu.
Ne ka≈æd√© prost≈ôed√≠ je stejnƒõ p≈ôedv√≠dateln√© jako svƒõt sportu.
Pomƒõr sign√°lu
a ≈°umu se m≈Ø≈æe nap≈ô√≠ƒç r≈Øzn√Ωmi oblastmi v√Ωznamnƒõ li≈°it a ƒç√≠m v√≠ce
p≈ôevl√°d√° n√°hodn√Ω ≈°um nad sign√°lem, t√≠m m√©nƒõ jsou v√Ωstupy z HR analytiky
u≈æiteƒçn√©. P≈ô√≠kladem zde m≈Ø≈æe b√Ωt relativnƒõ ne√∫spƒõ≈°n√° snaha p≈ôedpov√≠dat
to, jak si baseballov√© t√Ωmu povedou v play-off. Na rozd√≠l od z√°kladn√≠
ƒç√°sti soutƒõ≈æe, kde se hraje dostatek z√°pas≈Ø na to, aby se vyru≈°il vliv
n√°hodn√©ho ≈°tƒõst√≠ a sm≈Øly, v pƒõtiz√°pasov√Ωch kolech play-off hraje n√°hoda
tak v√Ωznamnou roli, ≈æe souvislost mezi celkov√Ωm poƒçtem v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v
z√°kladn√≠ ƒç√°sti a po≈ôad√≠m t√Ωmu v play-off je t√©mƒõ≈ô nulov√°.

mnohdy stav√≠ statistick√© modely do hor≈°√≠ho svƒõtla ne≈æ jinak m√©nƒõ p≈ôesn√©

Velikost v√Ωhody, kterou n√°m zaveden√≠ HR analytiky d√°v√°, m≈Ø≈æe b√Ωt
z√°visl√° na tom, zda podobn√© postupy vyu≈æ√≠v√° tak√© na≈°e konkurence. Opƒõt
to lze celkem dob≈ôe dolo≈æit na oaklandsk√Ωch ‚Äû√Åƒçk√°ch‚Äú. Jejich v√Ωsledky se
mezi lety 2002 a≈æ 2012, tj. v dobƒõ po zve≈ôejnƒõn√≠ Moneyballu, kdy ji≈æ
v≈°echny t√Ωmy mƒõly p≈ô√≠le≈æitost sezn√°mit se s principy prediktivn√≠
analytiky a zav√©st ji do sv√© praxe, zaƒçaly v√≠ce p≈ôibli≈æovat v√Ωsledk≈Øm

≈æe s t√≠m, jak se st√°le v√≠ce spoleƒçnost√≠ bude p≈ôi ≈ô√≠zen√≠ lidsk√Ωch zdroj≈Ø

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si pr≈Ømƒõrnou sumu mezd vypl√°cen√Ωch jednotliv√Ωmi t√Ωmy sv√Ωm hr√°ƒç≈Øm v letech 2002-2012 
prumerna_suma_MezdHracu2 <- mzdyHracu %>%
  filter(yearID > 2001 & yearID <= 2012) %>%
  group_by(teamID) %>%
  summarise(prumerna_suma_MezdHracu = sum(salary)/length(unique(yearID)))

# Vypoƒçtƒõme si pro jednotliv√© t√Ωmy pr≈Ømƒõrn√Ω poƒçet v√Ωher za sez√≥nu v letech 2002-2012
prumerny_pocet_vyher2 <- vyhryTymu %>%

# Vyj√°d≈ôeme si graficky vztah mezi poƒçtem v√Ωher a mno≈æstv√≠m penƒõz, kter√© t√Ωmy vynakl√°daj√≠ na mzdy sv√Ωch hr√°ƒç≈Ø 
prumerna_suma_MezdHracu2 %>%

  mutate(OAK = ifelse(teamID == "OAK", "ano", "ne")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x= prumerna_suma_MezdHracu, y = prumerny_pocet_vyher, fill = OAK)) +
  geom_point()+
  ggtitle("Mzdy hr√°ƒç≈Ø a poƒçet v√≠tƒõzstv√≠ v letech 2002-2012")+
  xlab("Pr≈Ømƒõrn√° suma mezd hr√°ƒç≈Ø (USD)")+
  ylab("Pr≈Ømƒõrn√Ω poƒçet v√Ωher za sez√≥nu")+
  geom_label_repel(
    aes(label = teamID),
    box.padding = 0.25, point.padding = 0.25,
    segment.color = 'grey50')+
  theme(legend.position="none")+
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#ffd400", "#ffffff"), 
                        labels = c("ano","ne")) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits=c(65,100), breaks = seq(65,100,5)) +
